questions.prompt: Connect what is safe and what is unsafe to share with someone on the internet.

pairs.right: Safe to share with friends
pairs.hint: General information — usually it’s okay to tell your name, but don’t add address or phone number.

pairs.right: Location where you live
pairs.hint: Address reveals where you live — do not share it publicly or with strangers.

pairs.right: Safe to share with friends
pairs.hint: Hobbies and interests are general things and are safe to share.

pairs.right: Secret combination for your account
pairs.hint: Password is a secret for logging into a profile/game — never tell it to others.

questions.prompt: Choose which explanation matches which action:

pairs.right: I ask an adult for help
pairs.hint: Ask an adult for privacy settings and safe data entry.

pairs.right: I create a new secret combination
pairs.hint: Make a long and unique password (mix of letters/numbers/symbols).

pairs.right: I always download only from safe sites
pairs.hint: Use official stores (Play Store/App Store) to avoid viruses.

pairs.right: I check if the video is for children
pairs.hint: Pay attention to content/age rating and ask an adult if unsure.

questions.prompt: Connect the security terms with their meanings.

pairs.right: Secret combination of letters and numbers you use to log in
pairs.hint: Password — think of a secret only you know. Don’t tell it to others.

pairs.right: Fake message or email that tries to trick you into giving data
pairs.hint: Phishing messages often say you’ve won a prize or ask you to enter a password — be careful and ask an adult.

pairs.right: Program that scans the computer and detects viruses
pairs.hint: Antivirus is like a shield for your device — helps remove dangerous files and keep the device safer.

pairs.right: Name you use to log into a profile or game
pairs.hint: Username should be fun, but don’t reveal real name or age.

questions.prompt: Connect the action with the correct advice.

pairs.right: Check if the site has "https" and a lock symbol
pairs.hint: Before buying, check if the website is secure (https and lock) and use trusted stores.

pairs.right: Always download only from official stores (Play Store, App Store)
pairs.hint: Official stores have verification and lower risk of malicious apps.

pairs.right: Don’t click on ads promising money, gifts, or free phones
pairs.hint: Ads that promise big prizes are often scams or contain dangerous links.

pairs.right: Create a strong password with uppercase/lowercase letters, numbers, and symbols
pairs.hint: Use a long and unique password for each account and don’t share it.

questions.prompt: Connect the term with its meaning.

pairs.right: Word or image you click on that takes you to another internet page
pairs.hint: Links lead to other pages — hover or ask an adult before clicking if unsure.

pairs.right: Conversation via messages with a friend or adult on the internet
pairs.hint: Chat is a written conversation; don’t share personal data with strangers.

pairs.right: Your personal page or account where your picture and information about you are
pairs.hint: Profile displays your picture and information — check what you post.

pairs.right: Internet mailbox where you send and receive messages
pairs.hint: Email is like internet mail — don’t open suspicious attachments and don’t give passwords via messages.

questions.prompt: Connect the internet terms with their meanings.

pairs.right: Exact location of a web page, e.g., https://www.facebook.com
pairs.hint: Web address is the text you enter in the browser to access a page.

pairs.right: Secure version of internet protocol that encrypts data
pairs.hint: HTTPS uses encryption (with a lock symbol) to protect data between you and the website.

pairs.right: Wireless network through which devices connect to the internet
pairs.hint: Wi-Fi enables internet connection without cables, usually via a router.

pairs.right: Transmission of video or audio in real time via the internet
pairs.hint: Live streaming is broadcasting or watching live video — e.g., YouTube Live or TikTok Live.

questions.prompt: Connect the internet terms with their meanings.

pairs.right: Exact location of a web page, e.g., https://www.facebook.com
pairs.hint: Web address is the text you enter in the browser to access a page.

pairs.right: Secure version of internet protocol that encrypts data
pairs.hint: HTTPS uses encryption (with a lock symbol) to protect data between you and the website.

pairs.right: Wireless network through which devices connect to the internet
pairs.hint: Wi-Fi enables internet connection without cables, usually via a router.

pairs.right: Transmission of video or audio in real time via the internet
pairs.hint: Live streaming is broadcasting or watching live video — e.g., YouTube Live or TikTok Live.

questions.prompt: Connect the terms with security risks.

pairs.right: Fake messages or pages trying to trick you into sharing personal data
pairs.hint: Phishing is when an attacker sends fake messages to get passwords or card numbers.

pairs.right: Fake profile pretending to be another person
pairs.hint: Catfishing is when someone uses a fake identity for fraud or manipulation.

pairs.right: Program that can harm your computer or steal data
pairs.hint: Malware is malicious software that steals information or damages devices.

pairs.right: Videos or photos altered with artificial intelligence to look real
pairs.hint: Deepfake uses AI to alter video or image so it looks real, but isn’t.

questions.prompt: Connect the terms with the correct steps for dealing with online bullying.

pairs.right: Offensive, threatening, or humiliating behavior on the internet
pairs.hint: Online bullying can happen through messages, comments, images, or videos that harm someone.

pairs.right: Sending evidence and screenshots to the platform, teacher, or institution
pairs.hint: Every social media has a 'Report' option — use it to protect yourself.

pairs.right: Talking to a parent, psychologist, or trusted person
pairs.hint: If you feel bad because of bullying, talk to someone who will listen and understand.

pairs.right: Be aware that no one deserves to be humiliated, help instead of laughing
pairs.hint: If you see someone being bullied, support them — don’t ignore or mock them.

questions.prompt: Connect the cybersecurity terms with their true meaning.

pairs.right: All information you leave on the internet – posts, comments, searches, photos
pairs.hint: Everything you do online leaves a trace. Even deleted posts may remain stored somewhere in some database.

pairs.right: Unique number that identifies your device when connecting to the internet
pairs.hint: IP address is like the address of your home, but for the internet — shows where you are connecting from.

pairs.right: Small files that websites keep to remember your activities or settings
pairs.hint: Cookies are used to remember logins, preferred language, but also to track your online behavior.

pairs.right: Process of converting data into a code that can only be read with a special key
pairs.hint: Encryption protects your conversations, passwords, and messages from unauthorized people.
